description: A nutritious and easy-to-make soup with lentils, carrots, and celery.
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened.
Add the rinsed lentils, vegetable broth, and thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 40-50 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

description: A world-famous Indian curry with tender chicken in a mildly spiced, buttery tomato sauce.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a pan, melt butter, add tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in the cream, garam masala, and kasuri methi.
Add the cooked chicken and simmer for 5-7 minutes.

description: A classic vegetarian Indian dish made with potatoes (aloo) and cauliflower (gobi).
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and temper with cumin seeds.
Sauté the onion until translucent.
Add the potatoes, cauliflower, turmeric, and coriander powder.
Stir well, cover, and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.

description: A delicious and savory vegan alternative to scrambled eggs.
instructions: Crumble the pressed tofu into a bowl.
Add nutritional yeast, turmeric, black salt, and garlic powder. Mix well.
Sauté onion in a non-stick pan until soft.
Add the tofu mixture and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
Serve immediately.

description: A popular, creamy, and refreshing yogurt-based drink from India.
instructions: Place mango chunks, yogurt, milk, and sugar in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
If the lassi is too thick, add a little more milk and blend again.
Pour into glasses, sprinkle with cardamom powder, and serve chilled.
